title.rendered: Did the presenter Don Francisco die from the coronavirus?  – The newspaper

content.rendered:
It’s false. Recently, an image was spread through social networks indicating that Mario Luis Kreutzberger Blumenfeld, the former presenter of the program Sabado Gigante, had allegedly died from covid-19.

Don Francisco (as he is popularly known) has not died or been infected with coronavirus.

The false image indicates that the information is from the Univisión television network; however, the channel has not published any information about it.

We also recommend you

Buckingham Palace breaks its silence after Harry and Meghan’s “explosive” interview with Oprah Winfrey

In fact, Don Francisco (79 years old) was live on July 11 through Instagram and Facebook in which he spoke with the Chilean presenter, Rafael Araneda, for the Radio Pudahuel program.

The false image of his death was published for the first time in March 2017 by the Diario Antillano page, in which they reviewed the fake news of the presenter’s alleged death, citing Univisión Noticias as an alleged source.

The current version of the false image, which has been spread on Facebook, adds that Don Francisco died from the virus that has affected a majority of countries.

The newspaper verified that the link that accompanies the publication is not from the cited source, but from Dailymotion, although when entering the link it redirects to another page that is not related to the alleged information.

Mario Kreutzberger has been the victim of false news on several occasions in which his supposed death has been spread. Currently, the famous presenter is in good health, as can be seen in his recent appearances on social networks.
